com.googlecode.junittoolbox
Class MultithreadingTester

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.junittoolbox.MultithreadingTester

public class MultithreadingTester
extends Object

Runs one ore more RunnableAsserts concurrently in multiple threads several times. Use this class for testing the robustness of thread-safe code like this:

     new MultithreadingTester().add(...).run();
If an Exception or Error is caught in any of the threads, the run() method (and therefore the test which calls the run() methods) will fail. Per default 100 threads are used whereby each thread executes its RunnableAssert 1000 times. You can change these settings like this:
     new MultithreadingTester().numThreads(...)
                               .numRoundsPerThread(...)
                               .add(...)
                               .run();

Converts the given Callables into RunnableAsserts and adds them to this MultithreadingTester, returns this to allow method chaining.

run

public void run()
Starts multiple threads, which execute the added RunnableAsserts several times. This method blocks until all started threads are finished. If an Exception or Error is caught in any of the started threads, this method will also throw an Exception or Error.

See Also:
numThreads(int), numRoundsPerThread(int)
